intro: Viola inamoena, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom from spring to early summer, and it is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Viola inamoena is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
